 }
 
+/// Returns the [`TextRange`] of the private name segment within the import statement.
+///
+/// For `from` imports where the private segment is in the module path (e.g., `from _a import b`
+/// or `from c._d import e`), this locates the segment within the module identifier. For imported
+/// members (e.g., `from i import _j`), this returns the name range from the alias. For straight
+/// imports (e.g., `import bbb.ccc._ddd as eee`), this locates the segment within the alias name.
+fn private_name_range(
+    import_info: &ImportInfo,
+    index: usize,
+    private_name: &str,
+    binding: &Binding,
+    semantic: &SemanticModel,
+    source: &str,
+) -> Option<TextRange> {
+    let stmt = binding.statement(semantic)?;
+    match stmt {
+        Stmt::ImportFrom(stmt_import_from) => {
+            if index < import_info.module_name.len() {
+                // The private segment is in the module path.
+                let module_id = stmt_import_from.module.as_ref()?;
+                find_name_in_range(private_name, module_id.range(), source)
+            } else {
+                // The private segment is the imported member name.
+                let alias = stmt_import_from
+                    .names
+                    .iter()
+                    .find(|alias| alias.name.as_str() == import_info.member_name.as_ref())?;
+                Some(alias.name.range())
+            }
+        }
+        Stmt::Import(stmt_import) => {
+            // For `import X.Y._Z as W`, find the private segment within the alias name range.
+            let alias = stmt_import.names.iter().find(|alias| {
+                alias.name.as_str() == import_info.qualified_name.segments().join(".")
+            })?;
+            find_name_in_range(private_name, alias.name.range(), source)
+        }
+        _ => None,
+    }
+}
+
+/// Finds the [`TextRange`] of a dotted name segment within the given range of source text.
+///
+/// Tokenizes the source within `range` and matches name tokens against `name` to locate the
+/// exact position of a specific segment in a dotted path like `a.b._c`.
+fn find_name_in_range(name: &str, range: TextRange, source: &str) -> Option<TextRange> {
+    let range_source = &source[range];
+    // Walk through the dotted segments of the identifier text.
+    let mut offset = TextSize::new(0);
+    for segment in range_source.split('.') {
+        if segment == name {
+            let start = range.start() + offset;
+            return Some(TextRange::at(start, segment.text_len()));
+        }
+        // Advance past this segment and the dot.
+        offset += segment.text_len() + TextSize::new(1);
+    }
+    None
+}
+
 #[expect(clippy::struct_field_names)]
 struct ImportInfo<'a> {
     module_name: &'a [&'a str],

diff --git a/crates/ruff_linter/src/rules/pylint/rules/import_private_name.rs b/crates/ruff_linter/src/rules/pylint/rules/import_private_name.rs
index e60ad913fc..054f839a66 100644
--- a/crates/ruff_linter/src/rules/pylint/rules/import_private_name.rs
+++ b/crates/ruff_linter/src/rules/pylint/rules/import_private_name.rs
@@ -3,8 +3,9 @@ use std::borrow::Cow;
 use itertools::Itertools;
 
 use ruff_macros::{ViolationMetadata, derive_message_formats};
-use ruff_python_ast::name::QualifiedName;
+use ruff_python_ast::{self as ast, helpers::is_dunder, name::QualifiedName};
 use ruff_python_semantic::{FromImport, Import, Imported, ResolvedReference, Scope};
+use ruff_python_trivia::{SimpleTokenKind, SimpleTokenizer};
 use ruff_text_size::Ranged;
 
 use crate::Violation;
@@ -96,7 +97,7 @@ pub(crate) fn import_private_name(checker: &Checker, scope: &Scope) {
         // We can also ignore dunder names.
         // Ex) `from __future__ import annotations`
         // Ex) `from foo import __version__`
-        if root_module.starts_with("__") || import_info.member_name.starts_with("__") {
+        if is_dunder(root_module) || is_dunder(&import_info.member_name) {
             continue;
         }
 
@@ -116,7 +117,7 @@ pub(crate) fn import_private_name(checker: &Checker, scope: &Scope) {
             .qualified_name
             .segments()
             .iter()
-            .find_position(|name| name.starts_with('_'))
+            .find_position(|name| name.starts_with('_') && !is_dunder(name))
         else {
             continue;
         };
@@ -137,7 +138,29 @@ pub(crate) fn import_private_name(checker: &Checker, scope: &Scope) {
         } else {
             None
         };
-        checker.report_diagnostic(ImportPrivateName { name, module }, binding.range());
+        let range = match binding.source.map(|id| checker.semantic().statement(id)) {
+            Some(ast::Stmt::ImportFrom(ast::StmtImportFrom { module, names, .. })) => {
+                if index < import_info.module_name.len() {
+                    module.as_ref().map_or(binding.range(), |module| {
+                        SimpleTokenizer::starts_at(module.start(), checker.locator().contents())
+                            .skip_trivia()
+                            .find(|token| {
+                                token.kind == SimpleTokenKind::Name
+                                    && checker.locator().slice(token.range()) == *private_name
+                            })
+                            .map_or(binding.range(), |token| token.range())
+                    })
+                } else {
+                    names
+                        .iter()
+                        .find(|alias| alias.name.as_str() == import_info.member_name)
+                        .map_or(binding.range(), |alias| alias.name.range())
+                }
+            }
+            _ => binding.range(),
+        };
+
+        checker.report_diagnostic(ImportPrivateName { name, module }, range);
     }
 }
